column4: Why isn't windows 7 listed in the grub boot menu after a ubuntu update and how can I fix this?
Why isn't windows 7 listed in the grub boot menu after a ubuntu update and how can I fix this?
did you try to simply run sudo update-grub2 in terminal?
the weird thing is windows was there before and nothings changed apart from an update afaik
hmm, you got 30_OS_Prober tagged as executable?
in /etc/grub.d a file named OS Prober, it has to be chmod +x so grub can use it when you do sudo update-grub2
could it be that the windows bootloader is somehow damaged?
dont think so, grub wouldnt really care if it was or not
you might try purging and then reinstalling grub, i had to do that once after 10.10 upgrade
poke grub remove in google, there is 2 parts to remove but i foget the exact names offhand
